title: Art-Based Interventions to Reduce Nurse Stigma Toward Prenatal Substance Use Education

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Professional training for current practitioners, conducted in a smartphone-centric limited technology environment, utilizing an asynchronous learning platform combining VR simulations and artistic activities

learning_goals: Learners reduce stigmatizing attitudes toward prenatal substance use (PSU) by over 30%.
Through art-based interventions, learners apply at least three empathetic communication strategies that reflect patients' perspectives.
In VR simulations, learners perform unbiased nursing interventions in PSU-related scenarios with 80% accuracy based on critical thinking.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
